1 <图标>hzhsqs</图标> <题头>Please choose the romantic features of the first stanza.（multiple choices）</题头> <阅读>I wandered lonely as a cloud 
 That floats on high o’er vales and hills 
 When all at once I saw a crowd,
 host, of golden daffodils; 
 Besides the lake, beneath the trees, 
 Fluttering and dancing in the breeze.</阅读> <解析>Natural scenery is often an important theme of romantic poetry. The poet compares the daffodils with himself, and contrasts them with lonely clouds to reflect the vivid scene of the daffodils. It inspires poets to create, and embodies the natural scenery with human being’s “life, emotion and expression”. 
诗人将水仙与自己对比，用孤云反衬出水仙花盎然生机的景象。自然景物往往是浪漫主义诗歌的重要主题, 它激发了人们创作的灵感, 而同时诗人也赋予自然景物以人的“生命、情感和表现力”。</解析> <选择>浪漫主义色彩1: Subjectivism: The description of natural objects is modified by the poet’s feelings.</选择> <选择>浪漫主义色彩2: Spontaneity: The role of instinct, intuition, and the feeling of “the heart” is stressed. </选择> <选择>浪漫主义色彩3: Singularity: It has a strong love for the remote, the supernatural, the mysterious, the splendid and the picturesque. </选择> <选择>浪漫主义色彩4: Worship of nature: The poet reads in nature some mysterious force. </选择> <选择>浪漫主义色彩5：There is a dominating note of solitude and melancholy. </选择> <答案>0</答案> <答案>4</答案> <答案解析></答案解析> <提示>浪漫主义色彩1, 5</提示>

2 <图标>hzhsqs</图标> <题头>Please choose the romantic features of the second stanza. （multiple choices）</题头> <阅读>Continuous as the stars that shine 
 And twinkle on the Milky Way, 
 They stretched in never-ending line 
 Along the margin of a bay: 
 Ten thousand saw I at a glance, 
 Tossing their heads in sprightly dance.</阅读> <解析>In the heart of poet, daffodils are no longer just a plant. It has become a messenger of God and a spiritual embodiment. It is this kind of spirit that rejoices the original melancholy heart. Here “continuous”and “never-ending” may suggest that the flowers leave an everlasting impact on Wordsworth. 
在诗人的心中, 水仙已不再是单单一种植物, 它成了神的使者，一种精神的化身。正是这种精神令原来本低沉忧郁的心灵变得欢欣鼓舞。 在这里“continuous”和“never-ending”暗示水仙花给他留下了永恒的影响。</解析> <选择>浪漫主义色彩1: Subjectivism: The description of natural objects is modified by the poet’s feelings.</选择> <选择>浪漫主义色彩2: Spontaneity: The role of instinct, intuition, and the feeling of “the heart” is stressed. </选择> <选择>浪漫主义色彩3: Singularity: It has a strong love for the remote, the supernatural, the mysterious, the splendid and the picturesque. </选择> <选择>浪漫主义色彩4: Worship of nature: The poet reads in nature some mysterious force. </选择> <选择>浪漫主义色彩5：There is a dominating note of solitude and melancholy. </选择> <答案>2</答案> <答案>3</答案> <答案解析></答案解析> <提示>浪漫主义色彩3, 4</提示>

3 <图标>hzhsqs</图标> <题头>Please choose the romantic feature of the third stanza.</题头> <阅读>The waves beside them danced; but they 
 Outdid the sparking waves in glee: 
 A poet could not but be gay, 
 In such a jocund company! 
 I gazed – and gazed – but little thought 
 What wealth the show to me had brought.</阅读> <解析>The poet stares at the daffodils lingeringly, without yet realizing the complete extent of the positive effects of encountering them. Even when the poet calls for the original emotion of “returning to nature”, he does not forget the relative independence of himself and nature. 
诗人久久凝望，却想象不到这奇景赋予了他多少精神财富。即使诗人在深情地呼唤 “回归自然”的原始情感时,也没有忘记自我与自然的相对独立性。</解析> <选择>浪漫主义色彩1: Subjectivism: The description of natural objects is modified by the poet’s feelings.</选择> <选择>浪漫主义色彩2: Spontaneity: The role of instinct, intuition, and the feeling of “the heart” is stressed. </选择> <选择>浪漫主义色彩3: Singularity: It has a strong love for the remote, the supernatural, the mysterious, the splendid and the picturesque. </选择> <选择>浪漫主义色彩4: Worship of nature: The poet reads in nature some mysterious force. </选择> <选择>浪漫主义色彩5：There is a dominating note of solitude and melancholy. </选择> <答案>1</答案> <答案解析></答案解析> <提示>浪漫主义色彩2</提示>

4 <图标>hzhsqs</图标> <题头>Select two lines from the first 3 stanzas that demonstrate the daffodils have the power to change Wordsworth’s mood.（multiple choices）</题头> <阅读>You have managed to find the memory, but in the last two sentences of the third stanza it is mentioned that the poet has doubts about the spiritual wealth that daffodils can bring. In order for the poet to gain permanent spiritual wealth, you need to answer questions to extend his memory, which enables Wordsworth to look back and re-experience the magical and special time he has whenever he feels upset or lonely.</阅读> <解析>您已成功找到记忆，但在第三节诗的最后两句提到诗人对水仙能够带来多少的精神财富产生了疑惑，为了使诗人获得永久的精神财富，需要您回答问题为他延长记忆。让诗人在任何沮丧之时都能够回忆起当时水仙花的画面，重获精神的救赎与治愈。</解析> <选择>A. “ I wandered lonely as a cloud ” (line 1)</选择> <选择>B. “ Continuous as the stars that shine ” (line 7) </选择> <选择>C. “ Ten thousand saw I at a glance ” (line 11)C. “ Ten thousand saw I at a glance ” (line 11) </选择> <选择>D. “ A poet could not but be gay ” (line 15)</选择> <答案>0</答案> <答案>3</答案> <答案解析></答案解析> <提示>正确答案：A, D</提示>

5 <图标>hzhsqs</图标> <题头>What does “ daffodil ” stand for? （multiple choices）</题头> <阅读></阅读> <解析></解析> <选择>A. the beauty of nature that could release the burden of sadness.</选择> <选择>B. the embodiment of a spirit leading to a happy heaven. </选择> <选择>C. a virtual image that has a temporary impact on poet’s mind.</选择> <答案>0</答案> <答案>1</答案> <答案解析>For the poet, nature is the object that the subject observes and reflects. To transcend oneself, one needs to rely on external power. And the innocence of nature can purify the human soul and rejuvenate the spirit. （对于诗人来说自然是主体进行观察、反映的客体。人要超越自身，需借助外在的力量。而大自然的纯真、明快能使人类的灵魂得到净化，精神得以重生。）</答案解析> <提示>正确答案：A, B</提示>

6 <图标>nvyk</图标> <题头>Walking and wandering with Wordsworth allow the experimenter to transcend his present circumstances, and encounter his genuine self. Why?（multiple choices）</题头> <阅读>Your poem-reading is about to end. Please complete the questions to find the way back to the former residence. \n您的体验即将结束，请完成弹出的相应问题，找到回故居的通道。</阅读> <解析></解析> <选择>A. The daffodils help to find and lift the spirit of the self-isolated poet.</选择> <选择>B. Wandering and walking make the poet pay much attention to the interaction between nature and his own nature. </选择> <选择>C. The poet finds himself in the paradise as soon as the image of golden daffodils flashes before his eye.</选择> <答案>0</答案> <答案>1</答案> <答案>2</答案> <答案解析>In the poet’s mind, the daffodils are not only a plant, but a symbol which represents a soul. As the proud image on the valley, the cheerful daffodils are the poet’s own description and his inner yearning. Therefore, the poet finds the symbol of his consciousness in nature and meets himself. \n(在诗人的心中, 水仙已经不仅是一种植物, 而且是一种象征, 代表了一种灵魂。那山谷上的高傲形象, 那水仙的欢欣雀跃的形象, 是诗人对自己的描述, 也是诗人内心的向往，从而使人得以在自然中找到了自我的对应物，遇见了自己。)</答案解析> <提示>正确答案：A, B, C</提示>

7 <图标>tym</图标> <题头>Hi,{0},你能想到为何这首诗中的“悠然见南山”一句，用的是“见”，而不是“望”吗？</题头> <阅读>yinjiuqi5.txt</阅读> <解析>从主客体的关系去考虑。</解析> <选择>A、从属关系</选择> <选择>B、平等关系</选择>
<答案解析>“见”是无意中的偶见，南山的美景正好与采菊时悠然自得的心境相映衬，合成物我两忘的“无我之境”。如果用“望”字，便是心中先有南山，才有意去望，成了“有我之境”，不就失去了一种天真意趣吗。</答案解析>

8 <图标>hzhs</图标> <题头>Since this is mentioned, Mr. Wordsworth, the use of the word ‘gaze’ in your poem seems to have a kind of thinking in the depiction of nature, what does it mean? {0}, what do you think?\n既然提到这个，在您的诗中用了gaze一词，在描绘自然中似乎带有着一种思索，这背后代表了什么吗？</题头> <阅读>iwanderedlonelyasacloud.txt</阅读> <解析>从体现自我的角度思考。</解析> <选择>A、从属关系</选择> <选择>B、平等关系</选择>
<答案解析>I constantly gaze at the daffodils, and project my desire for joy and eternal spirit on the daffodils. This is because I long to find the meaning of my own life in it.</答案解析>
